hints.label: thm-qsd-cft-correspondence
hints.title: ✅ QSD-CFT Correspondence - NOW RIGOROUS
hints.content:
2531: :label: thm-qsd-cft-correspondence
2532: 
2533: **With Hypothesis H3 ({prf:ref}`hyp-n-point-correlation-convergence`) now proven**, consider the Fragile Gas with gamma channel potential:
2534: 
2535: $$
2536: V_{\text{total}}(x, S) = V_{\text{fit}}(x, S) - \gamma_R R(x, S) + \gamma_W \|C(x, S)\|^2
2537: $$
2538: 
2539: In 2D ($d=2$) and in the combined limits:
2540: 1. $\gamma_W \to \infty$ (strong Weyl penalty, enforcing $C = 0$)
2541: 2. $N \to \infty$ (thermodynamic limit)
2542: 3. $\gamma_R$ held fixed
2543: 
2544: Then the quasi-stationary distribution $\rho_{\text{QSD}}$ defines a 2D Conformal Field Theory characterized by:
2545: 
2546: **Property (i): Conformal Invariance of Correlators**
2547: 
2548: For any conformal transformation $z \to w(z) = f(z)$ (holomorphic function), the n-point correlation functions of the stress-energy tensor transform according to the CFT rule:
2549: 
2550: $$
2551: \langle T(w_1, \bar{w}_1) \cdots T(w_n, \bar{w}_n) \rangle_{\text{QSD}} = \prod_{i=1}^n \left(f'(z_i)\right)^2 \langle T(z_1, \bar{z}_1) \cdots T(z_n, \bar{z}_n) \rangle_{\text{QSD}} + \text{anomaly}
2552: $$
2553: 
2554: where the anomaly term involves the Schwarzian derivative $\{f, z\} = f'''/f' - \frac{3}{2}(f''/f')^2$ for $n=1$.
2555: 
2556: **Property (ii): Holomorphicity**
2557: 
2558: The stress-energy tensor splits into holomorphic and anti-holomorphic parts:
2559: 
2560: $$
2561: \langle T_{\mu\nu}(z, \bar{z}) \rangle_{\text{QSD}} = \langle T(z) \rangle \delta_{\mu z} \delta_{\nu z} + \langle \bar{T}(\bar{z}) \rangle \delta_{\mu \bar{z}} \delta_{\nu \bar{z}}
2562: $$
2563: 
2564: with
2565: 
2566: $$
2567: \partial_{\bar{z}} \langle T(z) \rangle = 0, \quad \partial_z \langle \bar{T}(\bar{z}) \rangle = 0
2568: $$
2569: 
2570: **Property (iii): OPE with CFT Structure**
2571: 
2572: The two-point function of the stress-energy tensor exhibits the characteristic CFT singularity:
2573: 
2574: $$
2575: \langle T(z) T(w) \rangle_{\text{QSD}} \sim \frac{c/2}{(z-w)^4} + \frac{2\langle T(w) \rangle}{(z-w)^2} + \frac{\partial_w \langle T(w) \rangle}{z-w} + \text{regular}
2576: $$
2577: 
2578: for some central charge $c > 0$ (computed in Part 4).

hints.raw_directive:
2528: We now prove the central claim: in the limit $\gamma_W \to \infty$, the quasi-stationary distribution of the Fragile Gas is characterized by correlation functions satisfying conformal Ward identities.
2529: 
2530: :::{prf:theorem} ✅ QSD-CFT Correspondence - NOW RIGOROUS
2531: :label: thm-qsd-cft-correspondence
2532: 
2533: **With Hypothesis H3 ({prf:ref}`hyp-n-point-correlation-convergence`) now proven**, consider the Fragile Gas with gamma channel potential:
2534: 
2535: $$
2536: V_{\text{total}}(x, S) = V_{\text{fit}}(x, S) - \gamma_R R(x, S) + \gamma_W \|C(x, S)\|^2
2537: $$
2538: 
2539: In 2D ($d=2$) and in the combined limits:
2540: 1. $\gamma_W \to \infty$ (strong Weyl penalty, enforcing $C = 0$)
2541: 2. $N \to \infty$ (thermodynamic limit)
2542: 3. $\gamma_R$ held fixed
2543: 
2544: Then the quasi-stationary distribution $\rho_{\text{QSD}}$ defines a 2D Conformal Field Theory characterized by:
2545: 
2546: **Property (i): Conformal Invariance of Correlators**
2547: 
2548: For any conformal transformation $z \to w(z) = f(z)$ (holomorphic function), the n-point correlation functions of the stress-energy tensor transform according to the CFT rule:
2549: 
2550: $$
2551: \langle T(w_1, \bar{w}_1) \cdots T(w_n, \bar{w}_n) \rangle_{\text{QSD}} = \prod_{i=1}^n \left(f'(z_i)\right)^2 \langle T(z_1, \bar{z}_1) \cdots T(z_n, \bar{z}_n) \rangle_{\text{QSD}} + \text{anomaly}
2552: $$
2553: 
2554: where the anomaly term involves the Schwarzian derivative $\{f, z\} = f'''/f' - \frac{3}{2}(f''/f')^2$ for $n=1$.
2555: 
2556: **Property (ii): Holomorphicity**
2557: 
2558: The stress-energy tensor splits into holomorphic and anti-holomorphic parts:
2559: 
2560: $$
2561: \langle T_{\mu\nu}(z, \bar{z}) \rangle_{\text{QSD}} = \langle T(z) \rangle \delta_{\mu z} \delta_{\nu z} + \langle \bar{T}(\bar{z}) \rangle \delta_{\mu \bar{z}} \delta_{\nu \bar{z}}
2562: $$
2563: 
2564: with
2565: 
2566: $$
2567: \partial_{\bar{z}} \langle T(z) \rangle = 0, \quad \partial_z \langle \bar{T}(\bar{z}) \rangle = 0
2568: $$
2569: 
2570: **Property (iii): OPE with CFT Structure**
2571: 
2572: The two-point function of the stress-energy tensor exhibits the characteristic CFT singularity:
2573: 
2574: $$
2575: \langle T(z) T(w) \rangle_{\text{QSD}} \sim \frac{c/2}{(z-w)^4} + \frac{2\langle T(w) \rangle}{(z-w)^2} + \frac{\partial_w \langle T(w) \rangle}{z-w} + \text{regular}
2576: $$
2577: 
2578: for some central charge $c > 0$ (computed in Part 4).
2579:

hints.label: lem-weyl-penalty-concentration
hints.title: Weyl Penalty Concentration
hints.content:
2590: :label: lem-weyl-penalty-concentration
2591: 
2592: For the partition function:
2593: 
2594: $$
2595: Z(\gamma_W) = \int \mathcal{D}S \, \exp\left(-\frac{1}{T} \int_{\mathcal{X}} V_{\text{total}}(x, S) \, \mu(dx)\right)
2596: $$
2597: 
2598: in the limit $\gamma_W \to \infty$, the measure concentrates on configurations satisfying $\|C(x, S)\|^2 \to 0$:
2599: 
2600: $$
2601: \lim_{\gamma_W \to \infty} \mathbb{P}_{\text{QSD}}\left(\int_{\mathcal{X}} \|C(x, S)\|^2 \mu(dx) > \epsilon\right) = 0
2602: $$
2603: 
2604: for any $\epsilon > 0$.
2605: 
2606: **Proof:**
2607: 
2608: For fixed temperature $T$, the QSD probability of a configuration $S$ is:
2609: 
2610: $$
2611: \rho_{\text{QSD}}(S) \propto \exp\left(-\frac{1}{T}\left[\int V_{\text{fit}} + \gamma_W \int \|C\|^2 - \gamma_R \int R\right]\right)
2612: $$
2613: 
2614: Define the average Weyl norm:
2615: 
2616: $$
2617: W(S) := \int_{\mathcal{X}} \|C(x, S)\|^2 \mu(dx)
2618: $$
2619: 
2620: For any $\epsilon > 0$:
2621: 
2622: $$
2623: \mathbb{P}(W(S) > \epsilon) = \frac{1}{Z} \int_{W(S) > \epsilon} e^{-\gamma_W W(S)/T} e^{-\text{other terms}/T} \mathcal{D}S
2624: $$
2625: 
2626: $$
2627: \le \frac{1}{Z} e^{-\gamma_W \epsilon/T} \int e^{-\text{other terms}/T} \mathcal{D}S
2628: $$
2629: 
2630: $$
2631: \le e^{-\gamma_W \epsilon/T} \cdot \frac{Z(\gamma_W = 0)}{Z(\gamma_W)}
2632: $$
2633: 
2634: As $\gamma_W \to \infty$, the ratio $Z(\gamma_W=0)/Z(\gamma_W)$ remains bounded (assuming the measure without Weyl penalty is well-defined), so:
2635: 
2636: $$
2637: \mathbb{P}(W(S) > \epsilon) \le C e^{-\gamma_W \epsilon/T} \xrightarrow{\gamma_W \to \infty} 0
2638: $$

hints.label: lem-conformal-invariance-qsd
hints.title: Conformal Invariance of the QSD Functional
hints.content:
2648: :label: lem-conformal-invariance-qsd
2649: 
2650: Assuming:
2651: 1. The metric $g_{\mu\nu}(x, S)$ induced by the swarm is conformally flat: $g = \Omega^2(x) \eta$
2652: 2. The fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}$ is a conformal scalar (scales as $V \to \Omega^{-\Delta} V$ under $g \to \Omega^2 g$ for some dimension $\Delta$)
2653: 3. The Ricci term $-\gamma_R R$ acts as a local chemical potential (not a global integral)
2654: 
2655: Then the effective action $S_{\text{eff}}[g] = -\log \rho_{\text{QSD}}[g]$ is invariant under **local conformal transformations** $g_{\mu\nu}(x) \to \Omega^2(x) g_{\mu\nu}(x)$ up to the Ricci-dependent term.
2656: 
2657: **Proof Sketch:**
2658: 
2659: The QSD satisfies:
2660: 
2661: $$
2662: \rho_{\text{QSD}}[g] \propto \exp\left(-\frac{1}{T} \int \left[V_{\text{fit}}(x) + \gamma_W \|C(x)\|^2 - \gamma_R R(x)\right] \rho_{\text{walker}}(x) dx\right)
2663: $$
2664: 
2665: Under a conformal transformation $g \to \Omega^2 g$:
2666: 
2667: 1. **Weyl term:** $\|C\|^2 \to \|C\|^2$ (Weyl tensor is conformally invariant in its definition, though its value changes with the metric)
2668: 
2669: 2. **Ricci term:** In 2D, $R \to \Omega^{-2} R - 2\Omega^{-2} \nabla^2 \log \Omega$ (conformal transformation law for Ricci scalar)
2670: 
2671: 3. **Fitness term:** Assuming $V_{\text{fit}}$ is a conformal scalar, $V \to \Omega^{-\Delta} V$
2672: 
2673: 4. **Measure:** $\sqrt{\det g} \, dx \to \Omega^d \sqrt{\det g} \, dx$ (volume element transformation)
2674: 
2675: The combination of these transformations implies that the action transforms with a total derivative term (the $\nabla^2 \log \Omega$ from Ricci) plus scaling from the fitness potential.

hints.label: def-swarm-observable-cft-operator
hints.title: Swarm Observable as CFT Operator
hints.content:
2716: :label: def-swarm-observable-cft-operator
2717: 
2718: A **swarm observable** is a function $\mathcal{O}(x, S)$ of the swarm configuration, such as:
2719: 
2720: - **Particle density:** $\rho(x, S) = \sum_{i \in \mathcal{A}(S)} \delta(x - x_i)$
2721: - **Momentum flux:** $\Pi_\mu(x, S) = \sum_{i \in \mathcal{A}(S)} v_{i\mu} \delta(x - x_i)$
2722: - **Kinetic energy density:** $\mathcal{E}(x, S) = \sum_{i \in \mathcal{A}(S)} \frac{1}{2}|v_i|^2 \delta(x - x_i)$
2723: 
2724: In the continuum limit, these observables are promoted to **CFT operators** $\Phi(z, \bar{z})$ with definite conformal weights $(h, \bar{h})$.
2725: 
2726: **Identification:**
2727: - Density $\rho(x)$ → primary field $\Phi_{\rho}(z, \bar{z})$ of weight $(h_\rho, \bar{h}_\rho)$

2713: Having established that the stress-energy tensor satisfies CFT properties, we now derive explicit Ward identities for physical swarm observables.
2714: 
2715: :::{prf:definition} Swarm Observable as CFT Operator
2716: :label: def-swarm-observable-cft-operator
2717: 
2718: A **swarm observable** is a function $\mathcal{O}(x, S)$ of the swarm configuration, such as:
2719: 
2720: - **Particle density:** $\rho(x, S) = \sum_{i \in \mathcal{A}(S)} \delta(x - x_i)$
2721: - **Momentum flux:** $\Pi_\mu(x, S) = \sum_{i \in \mathcal{A}(S)} v_{i\mu} \delta(x - x_i)$
2722: - **Kinetic energy density:** $\mathcal{E}(x, S) = \sum_{i \in \mathcal{A}(S)} \frac{1}{2}|v_i|^2 \delta(x - x_i)$
2723: 
2724: In the continuum limit, these observables are promoted to **CFT operators** $\Phi(z, \bar{z})$ with definite conformal weights $(h, \bar{h})$.
2725: 
2726: **Identification:**
2727: - Density $\rho(x)$ → primary field $\Phi_{\rho}(z, \bar{z})$ of weight $(h_\rho, \bar{h}_\rho)$
2728: - Momentum flux → CFT current

hints.label: thm-swarm-ward-identities
hints.title: ✅ Ward-Takahashi Identities for Swarm Observables - NOW RIGOROUS
hints.content:
2733: :label: thm-swarm-ward-identities
2734: 
2735: **With Hypothesis H3 ({prf:ref}`hyp-n-point-correlation-convergence`) now proven**, for a swarm observable $\mathcal{O}(x, S)$ corresponding to a CFT primary field $\Phi_h(z, \bar{z})$ of conformal weight $(h, h)$ (scalar), the n-point correlation function with stress-energy tensor insertions satisfies:
2736: 
2737: $$
2738: \langle T(w) \Phi_h(z_1, \bar{z}_1) \cdots \Phi_h(z_n, \bar{z}_n) \rangle_{\text{QSD}} = \sum_{i=1}^n \left[\frac{h}{(w - z_i)^2} + \frac{\partial_{z_i}}{w - z_i}\right] \langle \Phi_h(z_1) \cdots \Phi_h(z_n) \rangle
2739: $$
2740: 
2741: **Proof (From First Principles):**
2742: 
2743: The proof derives Ward identities directly from swarm dynamics, proceeding in four steps.
2744: 
2745: **Step 1: Fundamental Symmetry Identity**
2746: 
2747: An n-point correlation function of swarm observables is:
2748: 
2749: $$
2750: \langle \mathcal{O}_n(\mathbf{z}) \rangle \equiv \int dS \, P_{\text{QSD}}(S) \, \mathcal{O}_n(\mathbf{z}; S)
2751: $$
2752: 
2753: where $\mathcal{O}_n(\mathbf{z}; S) = \prod_{j=1}^n \Phi_h(z_j, \bar{z}_j; S)$ and the integral is over swarm phase space $S = \{x_i, v_i\}_{i=1}^N$.
2754: 
2755: Consider an infinitesimal coordinate transformation $x^\mu \to x'^\mu = x^\mu + \epsilon^\mu(x)$. Since the total integral is invariant:
2756: 
2757: $$
2758: \delta \langle \mathcal{O}_n \rangle = \int \delta(P_{\text{QSD}}(S) \, \mathcal{O}_n(\mathbf{z}; S)) \, dS = 0
2759: $$
2760: 
2761: Using the product rule:
2762: 
2763: $$
2764: \langle \delta \mathcal{O}_n(\mathbf{z}) \rangle + \langle \mathcal{O}_n(\mathbf{z}) \, \delta(\log P_{\text{QSD}}) \rangle = 0
2765: $$
2766: 
2767: **Step 2: Stress-Energy Tensor as Generator**
2768: 
2769: This is the core step linking dynamics to field theory. The QSD has form $P_{\text{QSD}}(S) \propto \exp(-H_{\text{eff}}(S)/T)$ for effective Hamiltonian $H_{\text{eff}}$. The variation of the measure is:
2770: 
2771: $$
2772: \delta(\log P_{\text{QSD}}) = -\frac{\delta H_{\text{eff}}}{T}
2773: $$
2774: 
2775: By {prf:ref}`thm-variational-empirical-connection`, the stress-energy tensor generates coordinate transformations:
2776: 
2777: $$
2778: \delta H_{\text{eff}} = \int d^2x \, T^{\mu\nu}(x) \, \partial_\mu \epsilon_\nu(x)
2779: $$
2780: 
2781: This identity confirms that $\hat{T}_{\mu\nu}$ is the true generator of spacetime transformations for the swarm.
2782: 
2783: In complex coordinates $(z, \bar{z})$ with $z = x^1 + ix^2$ and transformation $z \to z + \epsilon(z, \bar{z})$:
2784: 
2785: $$
2786: \delta H_{\text{eff}} = \frac{i}{2} \int d^2z \, \left( T_{zz} \partial_{\bar{z}}\epsilon + T_{\bar{z}\bar{z}} \partial_z \bar{\epsilon} + T_{z\bar{z}}\partial_z \epsilon + T_{\bar{z}z}\partial_{\bar{z}}\bar{\epsilon} \right)
2787: $$
2788: 
2789: The **gamma channel** enforces conformal invariance, dynamically forcing tracelessness $T^\mu_\mu = 0$. In complex coordinates: $T_{z\bar{z}} = T_{\bar{z}z} = 0$. The holomorphic and anti-holomorphic components $T(z) \equiv T_{zz}(z)$ and $\bar{T}(\bar{z}) \equiv T_{\bar{z}\bar{z}}(\bar{z})$ are conserved: $\partial_{\bar{z}}T(z) = 0$ and $\partial_z \bar{T}(\bar{z}) = 0$.
2790: 
2791: The variation of the log-measure becomes:
2792: 
2793: $$
2794: \delta(\log P_{\text{QSD}}) = \frac{1}{2\pi} \int d^2w \left( T(w) \partial_{\bar{w}}\epsilon(w) + \bar{T}(\bar{w}) \partial_w \bar{\epsilon}(\bar{w}) \right)
2795: $$
2796: 
2797: Substituting into Step 1's symmetry relation:
2798: 
2799: $$
2800: \langle \delta \mathcal{O}_n \rangle = - \frac{1}{2\pi} \int d^2w \left\langle \mathcal{O}_n \left( T(w) \partial_{\bar{w}}\epsilon(w) + \bar{T}(\bar{w}) \partial_w \bar{\epsilon}(\bar{w}) \right) \right\rangle
2801: $$
2802: 
2803: **Step 3: Extract Integral Ward Identity**
2804: 
2805: **Choose specific transformation:** $\epsilon(w) = 1/(z-w)$, $\bar{\epsilon}(\bar{w}) = 0$. This is holomorphic except for a simple pole at $w=z$.
2806: 
2807: The anti-holomorphic derivative (Cauchy-Green formula):
2808: 
2809: $$
2810: \partial_{\bar{w}} \epsilon(w) = \partial_{\bar{w}}\left(\frac{1}{z-w}\right) = 2\pi \delta^{(2)}(z-w)
2811: $$
2812: 
2813: The integral collapses:
2814: 
2815: $$
2816: \text{RHS} = - \frac{1}{2\pi} \int d^2w \langle \mathcal{O}_n T(w) (2\pi \delta^{(2)}(z-w)) \rangle = - \langle \mathcal{O}_n T(z) \rangle
2817: $$
2818: 
2819: **Evaluate LHS:** A scalar primary field $\Phi_h(z, \bar{z})$ of weight $(h, h)$ transforms as:
2820: 
2821: $$
2822: \delta \Phi_h(z) = - \left( \epsilon(z) \frac{\partial}{\partial z} + h (\partial_z \epsilon) \right) \Phi_h(z) - \left( \bar{\epsilon}(z) \frac{\partial}{\partial \bar{z}} + h (\partial_{\bar{z}} \bar{\epsilon}) \right) \Phi_h(z)
2823: $$
2824: 
2825: For $\epsilon(w) = 1/(z-w)$:
2826: - $\epsilon(z_i) = 1/(z-z_i)$
2827: - $\partial_w \epsilon(w)|_{w=z_i} = 1/(z-z_i)^2$
2828: 
2829: The variation of $\mathcal{O}_n = \prod \Phi_h(z_j)$:
2830: 
2831: $$
2832: \langle \delta \mathcal{O}_n \rangle = \sum_{i=1}^n \left\langle \left( - \frac{1}{z-z_i}\frac{\partial}{\partial z_i} - \frac{h}{(z-z_i)^2} \right) \mathcal{O}_n \right\rangle
2833: $$
2834: 
2835: **Equate LHS and RHS:**
2836: 
2837: $$
2838: \sum_{i=1}^n \left\langle \left( - \frac{1}{z-z_i}\frac{\partial}{\partial z_i} - \frac{h}{(z-z_i)^2} \right) \mathcal{O}_n \right\rangle = - \langle \mathcal{O}_n T(z) \rangle
2839: $$
2840: 
2841: Multiplying by -1 and renaming $z \to w$:
2842: 
2843: $$
2844: \langle T(w) \mathcal{O}_n \rangle = \sum_{i=1}^n \left[ \frac{h}{(w-z_i)^2} + \frac{1}{w-z_i}\frac{\partial}{\partial z_i} \right] \langle \mathcal{O}_n \rangle
2845: $$
2846: 
2847: **Step 4: Conclusion**
2848: 
2849: This derivation demonstrates how Ward identities emerge directly from Fragile Gas dynamics. The proof rests on two pillars:
2850:

hints.section: ## Part 3: Main Results: Conformal Symmetry of Swarm Dynamics
hints.raw_directive:
2730: :::
2731: 
2732: :::{prf:theorem} ✅ Ward-Takahashi Identities for Swarm Observables - NOW RIGOROUS
2733: :label: thm-swarm-ward-identities
2734: 
2735: **With Hypothesis H3 ({prf:ref}`hyp-n-point-correlation-convergence`) now proven**, for a swarm observable $\mathcal{O}(x, S)$ corresponding to a CFT primary field $\Phi_h(z, \bar{z})$ of conformal weight $(h, h)$ (scalar), the n-point correlation function with stress-energy tensor insertions satisfies:
2736: 
2737: $$
2738: \langle T(w) \Phi_h(z_1, \bar{z}_1) \cdots \Phi_h(z_n, \bar{z}_n) \rangle_{\text{QSD}} = \sum_{i=1}^n \left[\frac{h}{(w - z_i)^2} + \frac{\partial_{z_i}}{w - z_i}\right] \langle \Phi_h(z_1) \cdots \Phi_h(z_n) \rangle
2739: $$
2740: 
2741: **Proof (From First Principles):**
2742: 
2743: The proof derives Ward identities directly from swarm dynamics, proceeding in four steps.
2744: 
2745: **Step 1: Fundamental Symmetry Identity**
2746: 
2747: An n-point correlation function of swarm observables is:
2748: 
2749: $$
2750: \langle \mathcal{O}_n(\mathbf{z}) \rangle \equiv \int dS \, P_{\text{QSD}}(S) \, \mathcal{O}_n(\mathbf{z}; S)
2751: $$
2752: 
2753: where $\mathcal{O}_n(\mathbf{z}; S) = \prod_{j=1}^n \Phi_h(z_j, \bar{z}_j; S)$ and the integral is over swarm phase space $S = \{x_i, v_i\}_{i=1}^N$.
2754: 
2755: Consider an infinitesimal coordinate transformation $x^\mu \to x'^\mu = x^\mu + \epsilon^\mu(x)$. Since the total integral is invariant:
2756: 
2757: $$
2758: \delta \langle \mathcal{O}_n \rangle = \int \delta(P_{\text{QSD}}(S) \, \mathcal{O}_n(\mathbf{z}; S)) \, dS = 0
2759: $$
2760: 
2761: Using the product rule:
2762: 
2763: $$
2764: \langle \delta \mathcal{O}_n(\mathbf{z}) \rangle + \langle \mathcal{O}_n(\mathbf{z}) \, \delta(\log P_{\text{QSD}}) \rangle = 0
2765: $$
2766: 
2767: **Step 2: Stress-Energy Tensor as Generator**
2768: 
2769: This is the core step linking dynamics to field theory. The QSD has form $P_{\text{QSD}}(S) \propto \exp(-H_{\text{eff}}(S)/T)$ for effective Hamiltonian $H_{\text{eff}}$. The variation of the measure is:
2770: 
2771: $$
2772: \delta(\log P_{\text{QSD}}) = -\frac{\delta H_{\text{eff}}}{T}
2773: $$
2774: 
2775: By {prf:ref}`thm-variational-empirical-connection`, the stress-energy tensor generates coordinate transformations:
2776: 
2777: $$
2778: \delta H_{\text{eff}} = \int d^2x \, T^{\mu\nu}(x) \, \partial_\mu \epsilon_\nu(x)
2779: $$
2780: 
2781: This identity confirms that $\hat{T}_{\mu\nu}$ is the true generator of spacetime transformations for the swarm.
2782: 
2783: In complex coordinates $(z, \bar{z})$ with $z = x^1 + ix^2$ and transformation $z \to z + \epsilon(z, \bar{z})$:
2784: 
2785: $$
2786: \delta H_{\text{eff}} = \frac{i}{2} \int d^2z \, \left( T_{zz} \partial_{\bar{z}}\epsilon + T_{\bar{z}\bar{z}} \partial_z \bar{\epsilon} + T_{z\bar{z}}\partial_z \epsilon + T_{\bar{z}z}\partial_{\bar{z}}\bar{\epsilon} \right)
2787: $$
2788: 
2789: The **gamma channel** enforces conformal invariance, dynamically forcing tracelessness $T^\mu_\mu = 0$. In complex coordinates: $T_{z\bar{z}} = T_{\bar{z}z} = 0$. The holomorphic and anti-holomorphic components $T(z) \equiv T_{zz}(z)$ and $\bar{T}(\bar{z}) \equiv T_{\bar{z}\bar{z}}(\bar{z})$ are conserved: $\partial_{\bar{z}}T(z) = 0$ and $\partial_z \bar{T}(\bar{z}) = 0$.
2790: 
2791: The variation of the log-measure becomes:
2792: 
2793: $$
2794: \delta(\log P_{\text{QSD}}) = \frac{1}{2\pi} \int d^2w \left( T(w) \partial_{\bar{w}}\epsilon(w) + \bar{T}(\bar{w}) \partial_w \bar{\epsilon}(\bar{w}) \right)
2795: $$
2796: 
2797: Substituting into Step 1's symmetry relation:
2798: 
2799: $$
2800: \langle \delta \mathcal{O}_n \rangle = - \frac{1}{2\pi} \int d^2w \left\langle \mathcal{O}_n \left( T(w) \partial_{\bar{w}}\epsilon(w) + \bar{T}(\bar{w}) \partial_w \bar{\epsilon}(\bar{w}) \right) \right\rangle
2801: $$
2802: 
2803: **Step 3: Extract Integral Ward Identity**
2804: 
2805: **Choose specific transformation:** $\epsilon(w) = 1/(z-w)$, $\bar{\epsilon}(\bar{w}) = 0$. This is holomorphic except for a simple pole at $w=z$.
2806: 
2807: The anti-holomorphic derivative (Cauchy-Green formula):
2808: 
2809: $$
2810: \partial_{\bar{w}} \epsilon(w) = \partial_{\bar{w}}\left(\frac{1}{z-w}\right) = 2\pi \delta^{(2)}(z-w)
2811: $$
2812: 
2813: The integral collapses:
2814: 
2815: $$
2816: \text{RHS} = - \frac{1}{2\pi} \int d^2w \langle \mathcal{O}_n T(w) (2\pi \delta^{(2)}(z-w)) \rangle = - \langle \mathcal{O}_n T(z) \rangle
2817: $$
2818: 
2819: **Evaluate LHS:** A scalar primary field $\Phi_h(z, \bar{z})$ of weight $(h, h)$ transforms as:
2820: 
2821: $$
2822: \delta \Phi_h(z) = - \left( \epsilon(z) \frac{\partial}{\partial z} + h (\partial_z \epsilon) \right) \Phi_h(z) - \left( \bar{\epsilon}(z) \frac{\partial}{\partial \bar{z}} + h (\partial_{\bar{z}} \bar{\epsilon}) \right) \Phi_h(z)
2823: $$
2824: 
2825: For $\epsilon(w) = 1/(z-w)$:
2826: - $\epsilon(z_i) = 1/(z-z_i)$
2827: - $\partial_w \epsilon(w)|_{w=z_i} = 1/(z-z_i)^2$
2828: 
2829: The variation of $\mathcal{O}_n = \prod \Phi_h(z_j)$:
2830: 
2831: $$
2832: \langle \delta \mathcal{O}_n \rangle = \sum_{i=1}^n \left\langle \left( - \frac{1}{z-z_i}\frac{\partial}{\partial z_i} - \frac{h}{(z-z_i)^2} \right) \mathcal{O}_n \right\rangle
2833: $$
2834: 
2835: **Equate LHS and RHS:**
2836: 
2837: $$
2838: \sum_{i=1}^n \left\langle \left( - \frac{1}{z-z_i}\frac{\partial}{\partial z_i} - \frac{h}{(z-z_i)^2} \right) \mathcal{O}_n \right\rangle = - \langle \mathcal{O}_n T(z) \rangle
2839: $$
2840: 
2841: Multiplying by -1 and renaming $z \to w$:
2842: 
2843: $$
2844: \langle T(w) \mathcal{O}_n \rangle = \sum_{i=1}^n \left[ \frac{h}{(w-z_i)^2} + \frac{1}{w-z_i}\frac{\partial}{\partial z_i} \right] \langle \mathcal{O}_n \rangle
2845: $$
2846: 
2847: **Step 4: Conclusion**
2848: 
2849: This derivation demonstrates how Ward identities emerge directly from Fragile Gas dynamics. The proof rests on two pillars:
2850: 
2851: 1. **Generator Identity:** {prf:ref}`thm-variational-empirical-connection` establishes that $T_{\mu\nu}$ is the complete generator of coordinate transformations, bridging microscopic particle dynamics to macroscopic field theory.
2852: 
2853: 2. **Conformal Invariance:** The **gamma channel** penalizes non-conformal configurations, ensuring tracelessness ($T_{z\bar{z}}=0$) and (anti-)holomorphicity of stress-energy components.
2854:

hints.label: prop-conformal-gauge
hints.title: Conformal Gauge Symmetry
hints.content:
2883: :label: prop-conformal-gauge
2884: 
2885: In the limit $\gamma_W \to \infty$ and assuming {prf:ref}`thm-qsd-cft-correspondence`, conformal transformations act as a **gauge symmetry** of the swarm dynamics:
2886: 
2887: **Statement:** Physical observables (those corresponding to gauge-invariant CFT operators) are invariant under conformal changes of coordinates $z \to w(z)$.
2888: 
2889: **Consequence:** When computing expectation values of physical observables, we are free to choose any conformally equivalent coordinate system. This can simplify calculations dramatically.

hints.label: ex-annulus-to-strip
hints.title: Conformal Map: Annulus to Strip
hints.content:
2915: :label: ex-annulus-to-strip
2916: 
2917: Consider a swarm confined to an annulus $r_1 < |z| < r_2$ in 2D. The conformal map:
2918: 
2919: $$
2920: w = \log z
2921: $$
2922: 
2923: maps the annulus to an infinite strip $\log r_1 < \text{Re}(w) < \log r_2$. Correlation functions on the strip are simpler to compute (they're quasi-periodic in $\text{Im}(w)$), and the results can be transformed back to the annulus using the conformal transformation law.
2924: 
2925: **Result:** The two-point function of a primary field $\Phi_h$ on the annulus is:
2926: 
2927: $$
2928: \langle \Phi_h(z) \Phi_h(z') \rangle_{\text{annulus}} = \frac{C_h}{|z|^{2h} |z'|^{2h}} \cdot \frac{1}{|1 - z'/z|^{4h}}
2929: $$
